channel.title: Ubuntu HDD
channel.description:
So, I built a new server for my site and misc. things at my house. And when I did so I swapped out my HDD for a new 1TB drive since my other one was pretty old and I was afraid of losing the files.
When I installed Ubuntu 14.04 on the new drive I ran into an issue with my old drive.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/xhtzNlc.png[/img]
nvidia_raid_member_100
This drive has never been apart of any RAID. The files should still be on there, if anyone knows a way to fix this, or to get around it. All I need to do is grab the files and I can't seem to figure it out.
Note: When I plug it into my HDD Dock and plug that into a Windows machine it just sits there, I can view it in Disk Manager, but that's it. The only option I can really do to it, is format it. And that is obviously not an option.
Help please.
The last thing I have tried is putting together my old server and trying to boot it up that way. But I don't think that will work, I took the drive to work and wasn't able to get into it. I have ran several HDD tests and the drive itself is not bad.
No I can't boot into it either on my current server. The OS on the drive is Ubuntu 12.04

item.title: Ubuntu HDD
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Muroth:

If you say you didn’t change anything on the old HDD couldn’t you just set in BIOS the old HDD as the primary? Then you could transfer any old files via USB

I can’t get it to boot at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu HDD
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

If you say you didn’t change anything on the old HDD couldn’t you just set in BIOS the old HDD as the primary? Then you could transfer any old files via USB

Read full topic

@Spades wrote:

When I installed Ubuntu 14.04 on the new drive I ran into an issue with my old drive.

This drive has never been apart of any RAID. The files should still be on there, if anyone knows a way to fix this, or to get around it. All I need to do is grab the files and I can’t seem to figure it out.

Note: When I plug it into my HDD Dock and plug that into a Windows machine it just sits there, I can view it in Disk Manager, but that’s it. The only option I can really do to it, is format it. And that is obviously not an option.

Help please.

The last thing I have tried is putting together my old server and trying to boot it up that way. But I don’t think that will work, I took the drive to work and wasn’t able to get into it. I have ran several HDD tests and the drive itself is not bad.

No I can’t boot into it either on my current server. The OS on the drive is Ubuntu 12.04
